maml:description.maml:para: Returns a dependency tree for a host.
Use this function to determine which hosts will be locked along with a network host.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of a resource for which to build a dependency tree.
Specifies the path to a file, containing host dependencies description.
Specifies the name of a resource for which to build a dependency tree.
Specifies a dependencies object instead of a file. This parameter is for internal purposes - you don't really need to use it.
Specifies the name of a resource for which to build a dependency tree.
Specifies the path to a file, containing host dependencies description.
Specifies a dependencies object instead of a file. This parameter is for internal purposes - you don't really need to use it.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retuns a dependency tree for SRV01.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the lock ID from a lock object.
Extracts the lock ID from a lock object and returns it as a string. The function basically has a meaning for debugging purposes only.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the lock object to examine.
Specifies the lock object to examine.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the ID from a lock object.

maml:description.maml:para: Locks a host on which a network file resides.

Use this function when you work with a network share and want to lock a host which hosts the share. The function puts the name of the file into lock's description. The function puts locks of the "File" type only.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies a path to the file with which you are about to work.
Arbitrary description of an entity which set the lock. We recommend to pass the name of a caller function here.
Specifies a path to the file with which you are about to work.
Arbitrary description of an entity which set the lock. We recommend to pass the name of a caller function here.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Puts a file lock to FS01 host. The caller name in that lock will be the name of the function invoking the command. Usually you'd want to save a lock object into a variable so later you could pass it to the `Unlock-Resource` function.

maml:description.maml:para: Locks a host with a "Generic" or a "Host" lock.
Use this function to just lock a host. If you want to prevent sunsequent locks on the host, use the `-Hard` parameter.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of a computer to lock.
Arbitrary description of an entity which set the lock. We recommend to pass the name of a caller function here.
Specifies that the host should be locked with a lock of the "Host" type.
Specifies the name of a computer to lock.
Arbitrary description of an entity which set the lock. We recommend to pass the name of a caller function here.
Specifies that the host should be locked with a lock of the "Host" type.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Locks a host called SRV01 with a lock of the "Host" type. The caller name in that lock will be the name of the function invoking the command. Usually you'd want to save a lock object into a variable so later you could pass it to the `Unlock-Resource` function.

Locks a local host with a lock of the "Generic" type. The caller name inside of that lock will be "admin-joe". Useful, when you work on a host and need to reboot it manually. In this example the user does not save the object into a variable, because it will be lost during the reboot anyway - they'll need to deal with that lock manually later.

maml:description.maml:para: Locks a host with some type of a lock plus it allows you to set some advanced options which the other two functions don't.
This function allows you more flexibility than `Lock-FileResource` and `Lock-HostResource`, but should not really be used except for testing and edge cases.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of a computer to lock.
Specifies an arbitrary description of an entity which set the lock. We recommend to pass the name of a caller function here.
Specifies which type of lock to use.
Specifies an arbitrary description of a lock. Currently is used by the Lock-FileResource function to store filename's here.
Specifies the timeout for each retry to set a lock.
Specifies the number of retries to set a lock, before raising an exception.
Specifies session ID which is used to identify all locks in this invocation. Use this parameter if you don't want to use auto-generated GUIDs as session IDs.
Prevents the function from resolving dependencies - it will lock only the host against which it was called.
Specifies the name of a computer to lock.
Specifies which type of lock to use.
Specifies an arbitrary description of an entity which set the lock. We recommend to pass the name of a caller function here.
Specifies an arbitrary description of a lock. Currently is used by the Lock-FileResource function to store filename's here.
Prevents the function from resolving dependencies - it will lock only the host against which it was called.
Specifies the number of retries to set a lock, before raising an exception.
Specifies the timeout for each retry to set a lock.
Specifies session ID which is used to identify all locks in this invocation. Use this parameter if you don't want to use auto-generated GUIDs as session IDs.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Locks SRV01 host w/o resolving its dependencies - the lock will be set on that host only.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests if a computer has a lock of some kind in place.
The function tests if a computer has a lock of some type on it. You can use the `-Type` parameter to specify in which type exactly you are interested.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of a computer to test.
Specifies for which types of locks to look.
Specifies the template which is used to get a folder where to search for lock files.
Specifies the template which is used to distinguish lock files.
Specifies the name of a computer to test.
Specifies for which types of locks to look.
Specifies the template which is used to get a folder where to search for lock files.
Specifies the template which is used to distinguish lock files.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Tests if SRV01 has a lock of the "Host" type on it.
Tests if SRV01 has any lock on it.

maml:description.maml:para: THe function allow you to gracefully unlock a network resource. The main purpose of such unlock is to maintain history of locks: it's implemented by utilizing a history folder on each host where disengaged lock files are moved. When the function disengages a lock file, it writes the current time in it so you can keep track of locks on a host.

maml:Description.maml:para: The lock object you would like to disengage.
Specifies the name of a folder where to put a disengaged lock.
Specifies the template which is used to distinguish lock files.
The lock object you would like to disengage.
Specifies the name of a folder where to put a disengaged lock.
Specifies the template which is used to distinguish lock files.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Unlocks a resource based on a lock object passed through the pipeline.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Unlock-Resource -LockObject $Lock
Unlocks a resource based on a lock object passed directly into the parameter.
